original_text: The results from two types of oxidation test are combined in this study. Table 1 shows the test matrix with the two approaches included. All the 100h tests and the test conducted at 650°C were performed using a thermogravimetric balance (TGA). The weight change during these tests was monitored continually and adjusted to accommodate buoyancy effects. All other tests were conducted in horizontal tube furnaces. For these latter tests, batches of specimens were placed in alumina boats and inserted into the furnaces at temperature. Intermittent weighing at room temperature was used to determine the oxidation kinetics. At selected time intervals, a specimen was removed from the batch for examination before the high temperature exposure continued for the remainder of the batch. Table 1 shows the time intervals chosen for examination. At 600°C one isothermal test, having an exposure time of 1000h, has been performed to date.
original_translation: Los resultados de dos tipos de pruebas de oxidación se combinan en este estudio. La Tabla 1 muestra la matriz de pruebas con las dos metodologías incluidas. Todas las pruebas de 100 horas y la prueba realizada a 650°C se llevaron a cabo utilizando una balanza termogravimétrica (TGA). El cambio de peso durante estas pruebas se monitoreó continuamente y se ajustó para tener en cuenta los efectos de flotabilidad. Todas las demás pruebas se realizaron en hornos de tubo horizontal. Para estas últimas pruebas, lotes de especímenes se colocaron en barcos de alúmina e insertados en los hornos a temperatura. Se utilizó un pesaje intermitente a temperatura ambiente para determinar la cinética de oxidación. En intervalos de tiempo seleccionados, se retiraba un espécimen del lote para su examen antes de que la exposición a alta temperatura continuara para el resto del lote. La Tabla 1 muestra los intervalos de tiempo elegidos para el examen. A 600°C se ha realizado hasta la fecha una prueba isotérmica, con un tiempo de exposición de 1000 horas.
original_sentences: The results from two types of oxidation test are combined in this study.
Table 1 shows the test matrix with the two approaches included.
All the 100h tests and the test conducted at 650°C were performed using a thermogravimetric balance (TGA).
The weight change during these tests was monitored continually and adjusted to accommodate buoyancy effects.
All other tests were conducted in horizontal tube furnaces.
For these latter tests, batches of specimens were placed in alumina boats and inserted into the furnaces at temperature.
Intermittent weighing at room temperature was used to determine the oxidation kinetics.
At selected time intervals, a specimen was removed from the batch for examination before the high temperature exposure continued for the remainder of the batch.
Table 1 shows the time intervals chosen for examination.
At 600°C one isothermal test, having an exposure time of 1000h, has been performed to date.
